getAvailableLayouts

public java.util.List getAvailableLayouts()
Description copied from interface: LayoutPersistence
Gets the list of available layout names. If usePref is true and profileKey has been set, the method will return the list of save layouts in user preference. If not, it will find out the layout file in user home directory.

Specified by:
getAvailableLayouts in interface LayoutPersistence
Returns:
the list of available layout names.

removeLayout

public void removeLayout(java.lang.String layoutName)
Description copied from interface: LayoutPersistence
Removes the layout. If usePref is true, the layout will be removed from user preference. Or else, the corresponding layout file will be deleted.

Specified by:
removeLayout in interface LayoutPersistence
Parameters:
layoutName -

Sets the layout directory. Layout directory is used to store layout files only when setUsePref is false.

saveLayoutDataAs

public void saveLayoutDataAs(java.lang.String profileName)
Save layout data to profile that specified in profileName Note: Always use all lower case. We found some problems with upper case on Windows.

Specified by:
saveLayoutDataAs in interface LayoutPersistence
Parameters:
profileName -

saveLayoutDataToFile

public void saveLayoutDataToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Save layout data to file that specified in fileName. The fileName should be full qualified file name. If the file exists, it will be overwritten.

Specified by:
saveLayoutDataToFile in interface LayoutPersistence
Parameters:
fileName -

getLayoutData

public java.lang.String getLayoutData()
Description copied from interface: LayoutPersistence
Gets frame arrangement information as a String. You can keep the value returned and pass it in to setLayoutData to put the frame.

Specified by:
getLayoutData in interface LayoutPersistence
Returns:
layout data

setUsePref

public void setUsePref(boolean use)
If true, use javax.uitl.pref to store frames layout data. The setting only has effect on Windows. On UNIX or Linux, javax.util.pref is never used because it has problem to store binary data

Specified by:
setUsePref in interface LayoutPersistence
Parameters:
use - use javax pref or not. Default is true

setUseFrameState

public void setUseFrameState(boolean useFrameState)
If true, the state of main frame will be persistented in layout data.

Specified by:
setUseFrameState in interface LayoutPersistence
Parameters:
useFrameState - true if the state of main frame will be persistented in layout data.

setUseFrameBounds

public void setUseFrameBounds(boolean useFrameBounds)
If true, the bounds of main frame will be persistented in layout data.

Specified by:
setUseFrameBounds in interface LayoutPersistence
Parameters:
useFrameBounds - true if the bounds of main frame will be persistented in layout data.
